comment.author: 27452735@N04
comment._content:
I really like your collection of old photos! Fascinating indeed.
There's no cathedral in this photo btw. The building to the right is known as the nieuwe kerk, i.e. the new church and although it's an impressive building, it's not a cathedral. As far as I know there has never been a catholic cathedral in Amsterdam; the see of the diocese of Haarlem-Amsterdam is located in the city of Haarlem.

comment._content: was the statue in the center moved back, or is my photo closer up? www.flickr.com/photos/joanne_paleczny/5897556939/in/photo...

comment.author: 57544135@N03
comment._content: @Jwaan  this statue was removed in 1914 the current statue was placed in 1956 and is called the National Monument and its build to remember the dutch casualties of World War II and all following armed conflicts with dutch involvement. And yes the current statue is placed further back.
